name: Introduction to Julia for Statistical Genetics
body:
The note is entirely written inside Jupeter notebooks.
> Why [Jupyter notebook](http://www.nature.com/news/interactive-notebooks-sharing-the-code-1.16261)? [Juliabox](https://www.juliabox.org) can be used to easily check this notebook. ###Authors * Hao Cheng (haocheng@iastate.edu) * Rohan Fernando (rohan@iastate.edu) ###Content * Section 0:   **Introduction** * [0.1](section_0/introduction.ipynb)   Why Julia * [0.2](section_0/installation.ipynb)   Installation (Done) * Section 1:   **Basics** * [1.1](section_1/MapFunction.ipynb)   basic types learnxiny and random number(distributions)? string(my_example) * [1.2](section_1/MapFunction.ipynb)   loops/control flow? * [1.3](section_1/RecProb.ipynb)   function * [1.4](section_1/LD.ipynb)   map (data structure)(learn it with example (factor incidence matrix) ) * [1.5](section_1/rwfiles.ipynb)   Read and write files (Done) * [1.4](basic/LD.ipynb)   regular expression * Section 2:   **Matrix** * [2.1](matrix/matrix.ipynb)   Matrix (Done) * [2.2](matrix/matrixAlgebra.ipynb)   Matrix Algebra (Done)

* Section 3:   **Advanced** * [2.1](Bayes/BayesTheorem.ipynb)   Pointer * [2.1](Bayes/BayesTheorem.ipynb)   Type(GenSim) * [2.2](Bayes/BayesInference.ipynb)   Module * [2.2](Bayes/BayesInference.ipynb)   Tricky things(Traps) in Julia * [2.2](Bayes/BayesInference.ipynb)   Example things(Traps) in Julia

* Section 4:   **Examples** * [2.1](Bayes/BayesTheorem.ipynb)   A inverse * [2.3](create a package)   Create your own pakckage * [2.2](Bayes/BayesInference.ipynb)   Gensel package
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
